title: AVENet: Disentangling Features by Approximating Average Features for Voice Conversion
author: Wenyu Wang (School of Software Engineering, Xi'an Jiaotong University), Hongwu Ding (School of Computer Science and Technology, Anhui University), Yiquan Zhou (School of Software Engineering, Xi'an Jiaotong University), Jiacheng Xu (School of Software Engineering, East China Normal University), Jihua Zhu (School of Software Engineering, Xi'an Jiaotong University), Shihao Li (Division of Music and Audio, Union Wheatland Culture and Media Ltd.), ...
relevance_why: This research on voice conversion techniques through feature disentanglement aligns closely with Haohe Liu's work in audio processing, offering potential methodologies that could enhance voice synthesis and audio restoration tasks.
background: Voice conversion technology modifies the speaker's voice in audio while keeping the spoken content unchanged, which can be complex due to muddled timbre and content features.
contribution: This paper introduces the AVENet framework to solve the entanglement of speaker timbre and content in voice conversion, achieving improved feature disentanglement and voice synthesis quality.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often utilize techniques like Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) which can produce unclear speech outputs, or rely heavily on labeled data, limiting utility.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a novel average feature generation strategy from frame-aligned parallel speech data, significantly enhancing the model's ability to approximate average features and reduce timbre leakage.

key_innovation: Utilizes a unique synthesis process to generate high-quality frame-aligned parallel speech data through a modified Text-to-Speech system, allowing for effective learning of average features for better disentanglement.
real_world_impact: This method could significantly improve applications such as real-time voice conversion or automated dubbing in multimedia content, potentially making voice technology more engaging and accessible.
limitations: While the approach shows improved disentanglement, it may inadvertently lose some nuances of content that rely on specific speaker characteristics.

new_terms.average feature: **Average feature** refers to an idealized content representation created by averaging feature vectors from frame-aligned parallel speech data, facilitating cleaner content extraction.
new_terms.frame-aligned parallel speech: **Frame-aligned parallel speech** denotes speech data where frames contain identical spoken content but different speaker characteristics, enabling effective timbre removal during processing.
